rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective. 'highest-risk situation' describes a past situation, 'increasing rate' describes infection rate.
statement_text: If you look at the cases that have occurred since 1997, when it [H5N1] first emerged in human cases in Hong Kong, through to mid-2015 to 2016, those years were by far the highest-risk situation. We’ve seen very few cases in humans since then [mid-2015/2016]. And part of that [the reason for very few human cases] is that the virus has changed—it [the virus]’s mutated to the point of where it is infecting other mammalian species and birds at an increasing rate.

rationale: The phrase 'highest-risk situation' is a superlative + risk noun. 'increasing rate' is neutral. Neither is a high-potency verb/metaphor.
